alert.note: Alert for Boone; Logan; Northwest Raleigh (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 6:54PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Logan and southeastern Boone Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 654 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Amherstdale-Robinette, or 10 miles east of Logan, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Amherstdale-Robinette, Wharton, Bald Knob and Amherstdale-Robine. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Flash Flood Watch remains in effect. Heavy downpours could cause rapid rises in water. If rising water is observed, move to higher ground. Do not drive into areas covered by water.
